original_title: Sri Lanka Treasuries auction yields fall across maturities
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka has sold 85 billion rupees of Treasury bills at an auction on Wednesday after offering 85 billion while yields across maturities fell, data from the state debt office showed.
The debt office sold 45 billion rupees in 3-month bills at 28.75 percent, down 84 basis points from a week earlier.
All 20 billion rupees in 6-month bills were sold at 27.77 percent, down 84 basis points from a week earlier.
A total of 20 billion rupees of 12-month bills were sold at 26.43 percent, down by 121 basis points from a week earlier. (Colombo/Mar 08/2023)
